monogr.title: A newe reuenge for an olde grudge. Lately sette forth by I.S. VVho buildeth not vpon sure grounde, hath often beene, and now is founde a losse of time, a vaine expence, thus saith Goddes worde. An ouerthrowe of his presence. Thankes to the Lorde
monogr.author: Sutton, J.

div.head: To the Reader.
div.p:
FOr asmuche as we are taught in the firste of Iosua, that in the booke of God we should recorde day and night: and also be circumspecte to doo accordyng to the same, that our wayes might prosper: so assuredly, they that in that sort trauell, and make therof a willinge exercise, shall finde therin such Felicitie, such fruitefulnes, and comforte,
as I (oh Christian Reader) am not with my penne able to expresse: for in the Scriptures is wealth to be founde for those that be in miserie: helth for such as be sicke: lighte to expell darkenesse: comfort to those that be afflicted: in extreme perill, present preseruation: and for the defence and sauegarde of suche as are of the householde of Faithe, there is also to be fownde
both armour and weapō, to wage battel with that aunciēt enemie Satan: of whom as the sacred Scriptures make mention, to haue bene euen from the beginninge an vtter enemie to Christ, his Gospell, and professours of the same: and sekinge in sundrie wise through his subteltie to subuert the, whome although the glorious God at no time leaueth vndefended, to the greater cōfusion
and shame of that subtile Serpent, yet for al that seaceth he not still to stirre vp his Hellish armie, continually to make new attemptes to trouble and assayle the flocke and famelie of the Faithfull: and that onely as muche as in them is, to suppresse, and darken the light of the glorious Gospel of our Sauiour Iesus Christe, which comfortablie shineth amongst vs, which through
Christe wee haue receiued, whiche we now enioye, and are partakers of (to God be thākes therfore) who graūt the same a free passage thorough the whole worlde, to the more magnifiynge of his mightie name, the cōtinuall comforte of his Church, and vtter destruction of the enemies and aduersaries of the same, For euer. Amen.
